original: Ysander, David Torsten, biskop, Linköping, f. 10/3/93 i Tölö, Hall. 1., av kyrkoh. Bengt Y. o. Amanda Wetter-quist. G. 23 m. Ebba Key-Aberg. Barn: Berit f. 24, Ursula 25, Bengt-Christer 31. — Stud:ex. v. Gbgs h. latin 11, teol. fil. ex. i Gbg 12, fil. kand. där 1’5, teol. kand. o. prakt. teol. ex. i Upps. samt prästex. i Gbg 19, teol. lic. i Upps. 25, teol. dr där 33. Fas,t :adj. i Upps. 19-20, tf. kyrkoh. i Vänge-Läby 20, ord. 23-30, tf. kontr :prost 22-24, pred. v. Akad. sjukih. i Upps. 20, adj. led. i Upps. dom-kap. somr. 26-23, sekr. i ärkestiftets stiftsråd 26, förest, f. sam^t lär. i kris-tend. v. Fjellstedtska sk. i Upps. 30-36, docent i teol. preno-t. o. teol. encykl. v. Upps. univ. 331-35, domprost i Gbg 315, biskop i Visby stift 36-47, e. o. hov-pred. 39, biskop i Linköp. stift fr. 47. Res. t. Engl. 12, Fölen o. Österr. 22, Engl. o. Holl. 27. Skr.: Det andl. nutidsläget o. kyrkan (19), Vänge-Läby förs :hem (28), Gudsordet o. religionerna (30), Das Judentum nach Ghristus (31), Missionen - Guds hemlighet (32), Hasidismien (33), Förkunnelsen o. för-kunnaren (tills. m. B. Jonzon 34), Herdabrev (3*7), I Gbgs domkyrka (37), Från Visby S :ta Maria (41), De hundra kyrkornas ö (41), Lyckans villkor (44), Folkförsoningen o. vedergällningen (44) m. fl. skr. i relig:hist. o. teol. frågor, art. i teol. o. kyrkl. tidskr. samt dagspressen. KNOlkl,
translated:
Ysander, David Torsten, bishop, Linköping, b. 10/3/93 in Tölö, Halland. 1st child of Vicar Bengt Y. and Amanda Wetterquist. Married on the 23rd with Ebba Key-Aberg. Children: Berit b. 24, Ursula b. 25, Bengt-Christer b. 31. 

Education: Graduated from Gothenburg high school of Latin in 1911, receiving a theology degree from Gothenburg in 1912, a Bachelor of Philosophy degree from Gothenburg in 1915, a theology degree and practical theology examination from Uppsala, and a priest examination in Gothenburg in 1919. Obtained a theological licentiate degree in Uppsala in 1925 and a theological doctorate there in 1933. 

Positions: Assistant professor in Uppsala from 1919 to 1920, temporary vicar in Vänge-Läby from 1920, permanent from 1923 to 1930, temporary archdeacon from 1922 to 1924, preacher at the Academy Hospital in Uppsala in 1920, adjunct member at the Uppsala Cathedral Chapter during the summers of 1926-1923, secretary in the diocesan council of the archbishopric in 1926, superintendent and teacher of Christian doctrine at Fjellstedtska School in Uppsala from 1930 to 1936, docent in theology and biblical exegesis at Uppsala University from 1931 to 1935, cathedral provost in Gothenburg from 1931, bishop of the Visby diocese from 1936 to 1947, temporary court chaplain in 1939, bishop of the Linköping diocese from 1947. Traveled to England in 1912, Denmark and Austria in 1922, England and the Netherlands in 1927. 

Works: "The Spiritual Present Situation and the Church" (1919), "Vänge-Läby Parish: Home" (1928), "The Word of God and Religions" (1930), "Das Judentum nach Ghristus" (1931), "Mission - God's Mystery" (1932), "Hasidismien" (1933), "Preaching and the Preacher" (written in collaboration with B. Jonzon, 1934), "Pastoral Letters" (1937), "In Gothenburg Cathedral" (1937), "From Visby St. Mary" (1941), "The Hundred Churches' Island" (1941), "The Conditions of Happiness" (1944), "The Reconciliation of the People and Retribution" (1944), and several more works on religious history and theological topics. Also wrote articles for theological and ecclesiastical journals as well as the daily press. Recipient of the Royal Order of the North Star (KNOlkl).

works.name: The Spiritual Present Situation and the Church
The Word of God and Religions
The Reconciliation of the People and Retribution
